div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of THOMAS L. THURSTON for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.}

The above entitled matter having come regularly on for hearing on the 3rd day of January, A.D. 1918, on the Order to Show cause and Petition for Writ of Habeas Cor- pus, and the Respondent's return thereto, and the Court having read the briefs of counsel and being fully ad- vised in the premises, and having filed a written opinion herein;
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that said Order to show cause and the Petition for Writ be and the same are hereby dis- missed, and the petitioner remanded to the custody of the Commissioner of Immigration.
Jeremiah Neterer United States District Judge
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Appli- cation of THOMAS L. THURSTON for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED IN THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION APR 25 1918 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Edm Lakin Deputy
